channel.title: Old Compiler, Not sure what to change
channel.description:
My variables are set and the compiler for the source will not work no matter what changes I make so I need help.
'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .
Compiler is:
@echo off
javac -source 1.5 -target 1.5 -classpath . -d bin *.java -g
pause
Source is good old dodian :)

item.title: Old Compiler, Not sure what to change
item.dc:creator: @zerogordo zerogordo
item.description:
@zerogordo wrote:

Yeah I thought I might add something to make it less complex as any of those might have been the error even after he didn’t have his java path set

Read full topic
item.source: Old Compiler, Not sure what to change

item.title: Old Compiler, Not sure what to change
item.dc:creator: @zerogordo zerogordo
item.description:
@zerogordo wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Probably: Your variables are set for Java, but may not be set for Javac.
Try using a direct path?

@echo off @title Compiling "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_YOUR.UPDATE.NUMBER\bin\javac.exe" -source 1.5 -target 1.5 -classpath . -d bin *.java -g pause[/quote]

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_YOUR.UPDATE.NUMBER\bin\javac" -d bin *.java

I believe That should work to I don’t exactly know what the -g or -source 1.5 -target 1.5 is for

The -classpath . has no point in anything

Read full topic
item.source: Old Compiler, Not sure what to change
